SED: A brilliant warrior as well as a great statesman, he established the Franks as undisputed masters of Gaul and led the army that defeated the Muslims in the Battle of Tours.
SWMH: A brilliant warrior as well as a great statesman, he established the Franks as undisputed masters of Gaul and led the army that defeated the Muslims in the Battle of Tours.
VANILLA: A brilliant warrior as well as a great statesman, he established the Franks as undisputed masters of Gaul and led the army that defeated the Muslims in the Battle of Tours.

SED: A legendary viking hero. He led numerous raids against the Franks and Anglo-Saxons, going so far as to sail up the Seine and successfully lay siege to Paris.
SWMH: A legendary viking hero. He led numerous raids against the Franks and Anglo-Saxons, going so far as to sail up the Seine and successfully lay siege to Paris.
VANILLA: A legendary viking hero. He led numerous raids against the Franks and Anglo-Saxons, going so far as to sail up the Seine and successfully lay siege to Paris.

SED: Seljuk was the eponymous founder of the Seljuk dynasty. His descendants sought adventure away from their ancestral home, eventually establishing the mighty Seljuk sultanate.
SWMH: Seljuk was the eponymous founder of the Seljuk dynasty. His descendants sought adventure away from their ancestral home, eventually establishing the mighty Seljuk sultanate.
VANILLA: An Oghuz Turkic warlord, Seljuk started out an officer in the Khazar army. He later went on to found his own clan, seeking adventure away from his ancestral home.

SED: Born an illegitimate bastard, he more than proved himself after successfully claiming the throne of England, becoming known as “the Conqueror.”
SWMH: Born an illegitimate bastard, he more than proved himself after successfully claiming the throne of England, becoming known as 'the Conqueror'.
VANILLA: Born an illegitimate bastard, he more than proved himself after successfully claiming the throne of England – becoming known as 'the Conqueror'.

SED: The founder of the Mongol Empire, proclaimed “Genghis Khan” (Universal Ruler) by the many subjugated peoples of the steppe. An extremely brutal and efficient leader.
SWMH: The founder of the Mongol Empire, proclaimed 'Genghis Khan' (Universal Ruler) by the many subjugated peoples of the steppe. An extremely brutal and efficient leader.
VANILLA: The founder of the Mongol Empire, proclaimed 'Genghis Khan' (Universal Ruler) by the many subjugated peoples of the steppe. An extremely brutal and efficient leader.

SED: A military leader and hero of great renown. The Moors dubbed him “El Cid” (“the Lord”), while the Christians called him “El Campeador” (“Outstanding Warrior”).
SWMH: A military leader and hero of great renown. The Moors dubbed him 'El Cid' ('the Lord'), while the Christians called him 'El Campeador' ('Outstanding Warrior').
VANILLA: A military leader and hero of great renown. The Moors dubbed him 'El Cid' ('the Lord'), while the Christians called him 'El Campeador' ('Outstanding Warrior').

SED: In his native tongue, Timur means “iron.” Despite being crippled by two arrows, he was both a military genius and a statesman capable of instilling great loyalty.
SWMH: In his native tongue, Timur means 'Iron'. Despite being crippled by two arrows, he was both a military genius and a statesman capable of instilling great loyalty.
VANILLA: In his native tongue, Timur means 'Iron'. Despite being crippled by two arrows, he was both a military genius and a statesman capable of instilling great loyalty.

SED: A freed slave, Sabuktigin founded a principality in Ghazna and laid foundation of the Ghaznavids, a dynasty that reached India to the east and Persia to the west.
SWMH: A freed slave, Sabuktigin founded a principality in Ghazna and laid foundation of the Ghaznavids, a dynasty that reached India to the east and Persia to the west.
VANILLA: The founder of the Gahznavid dynasty. In his youth he lived as a slave, but in later life came to rule a mighty kingdom which expanded far towards India.

SED: The founder of the Pala dynasty, said to be descended from the mythical Suryavansha (Sun dynasty). He came to rule a massive kingdom, encompassing all of Bengal.
SWMH: The founder of the Pala dynasty, said to be descended from the mythical Suryavansha (Sun Dynasty). He came to rule a massive kingdom, encompassing all of Bengal.
VANILLA: The founder of the Pala dynasty, said to be descended from the mythical Suryavansha (Sun Dynasty). He came to rule a massive kingdom, encompassing all of Bengal.

SED: One of the greatest rulers India has ever seen. His conquests included the Andamans, Sri Lanka, the Maldives and even territories in Burma, Thailand and Indonesia.
SWMH: One of the greatest rulers India has ever seen. His conquests included the Andamans, Sri Lanka, the Maldives and even territories in Burma, Thailand and Indonesia.
VANILLA: One of the greatest rulers India has ever seen. His conquests included the Andamans, Sri Lanka, the Maldives and even territories in Burma, Thailand and Indonesia.

SED: The first Sultan of Egypt and Syria. He successfully led the Muslim military campaign against the Crusader States in the Levant.
SWMH: The first Sultan of Egypt and Syria. He successfully led the Muslim military campaign against the Crusader States in the Levant.
VANILLA: The first Sultan of Egypt and Syria. He successfully led the Muslim military campaign against the Crusader States in the Levant.

SED: The founder of the Rurikid dynasty. He was a Varangian chieftain who ruled over the Rus’ and built several settlements, the most famous of which lies in Novgorod.
SWMH: The founder of the Rurikid Dynasty. He was a Varangian chieftain who ruled over the Rus' and built several settlements, the most famous of which lies in Novgorod.
VANILLA: The founder of the Rurikid Dynasty. He was a Varangian chieftain who ruled over the Rus' and built several settlements, the most famous of which lies in Novgorod.

SED: A remarkable politician, strategist, and statesman. He successfully turned Poland into a country as powerful as the realms of the west.

VANILLA: A remarkable politician, strategist, and statesman. He successfully turned Poland into a country as powerful as the realms of the west.

SED: A great military leader and warrior who became known as “the Lionheart.” He was a leader of the Third Crusade, scoring numerous victories against the Muslims.

VANILLA: A great military leader and warrior who became known as 'the Lionheart'. He was a figurehead of the Third Crusade, scoring numerous victories against the Muslims.

SED: One of the most powerful women of Western Europe. She was a patron of literature and a military commander, as well as a leader in the Second Crusade.

VANILLA: A brave knight who fought in the Wars of Scottish Independence. After defeating an English army, he was appointed 'Guardian of Scotland'.

VANILLA: The Kende (sacred ruler) of the Magyar tribes. He went on to conquer the Carpathian Basin, making a new home for the Hungarian people.

SED: One of the greatest of the East Roman emperors, his rule brought about an era of glory, prosperity, art and imperial might.
SWMH: One of the greatest of the East Roman emperors, his rule brought about an era of glory, prosperity, art and imperial might.
VANILLA: One of the greatest of the East Roman emperors, his rule brought about an era of glory, prosperity, art and imperial might.

SED: A great emperor who fought both the Seljuk Turks and the Normans. His reforms stopped the imperial decline, restoring much of the empire’s former glory.
SWMH: A great emperor who fought both the Seljuk Turks and the Normans. His reforms stopped the imperial decline, restoring much of the empire's former glory.
VANILLA: A great emperor who fought both the Seljuk Turks and the Normans. His reforms stopped the imperial decline, restoring much of the former glory.

SED: A legendary Varangian warrior. He ruled over the Kiev area, becoming its first king.
SWMH: A legendary Varangian warrior. He ruled over the Kiev area, becoming its first king.
VANILLA: A legendary Varangian warrior. He ruled over the Kiev area, becoming its first king.

SED: Brother and successor of Tomislav, the first king of Croatia. Brothers Tomislav and Trpimir laid the foundation of a sizeable kingdom that would last for centuries to come.
SWMH: Brother and successor of Tomislav, the first king of Croatia. Brothers Tomislav and Trpimir laid the foundation of a sizeable kingdom that would last for centuries to come.
VANILLA: A peaceful ruler who rose to kingship through skilled diplomacy. His rule saw huge economic and cultural advancements take place in Croatia.

SED: An Irish high king of legend. He managed to unify the warring leaders of Ireland and end the Viking occupation of the isle.
SWMH: An Irish high king of legend. He managed to unify the warring leaders of Ireland and end the Viking occupation of the isle.
VANILLA: An Irish high king of legend. He managed to unify the warring leaders of Ireland and end the Viking occupation of the isle.

SED: The founder of the Tibetan Empire who unified several Tibetan kingdoms under his rule. He also introduced Buddhism to Tibet and created the Tibetan alphabet.
SWMH: The founder of the Tibetan Empire who unified several Tibetan kingdoms under his rule. He also introduced Buddhism to Tibet and created the Tibetan Alphabet.
VANILLA: The founder of the Tibetan Empire who unified several Tibetan kingdoms under his rule. He also introduced Buddhism to Tibet and created the Tibetan Alphabet.

SED: The legendary founder of the Merovingian dynasty. He joined his tribal forces with Rome to drive the Huns out of Gaul, ending Attila’s ambitions in the area.
SWMH: The legendary founder of the Merovingian dynasty. He joined his tribal forces with Rome to drive the Huns out of Gaul, ending Attila's ambitions in the area.
VANILLA: The legendary founder of the Merovingian dynasty. He joined his tribal forces with Rome to drive the Huns out of Gaul, ending Attila's ambitions in the area.

SED: The Solomonid dynasty claim direct descendance from the biblical Solomon. The dynasty continued to rule Ethiopia into the twentieth century.
SWMH: The Solomonid dynasty claim direct descendance from the biblical Solomon. The dynasty continued to rule Ethiopia into the twentieth century.
VANILLA: The Solomonid Dynasty claim direct descendance from the biblical Solomon, a king of Israel famed for legendary wisdom and wealth.

SED: Kubrat claims descendance from Attila – one of the most feared enemies of ancient Rome, who united numerous tribal clans under his banner.
SWMH: Kubrat claims descendance from Attila - one of the most feared enemies of ancient Rome, who united numerous tribal clans under his banner.
VANILLA: Kubrat claims descendance from Attila - one of the most feared enemies of ancient Rome, who united numerous tribal clans under his banner.

SED: The Ashina clan rose to prominence after revolting against the Rouran khaganate. Members of the clan are considered sacred, if not divine, by the people of the steppe.
SWMH: The Ashina clan rose to prominence after revolting against the Rouran Khaganate. Members of the clan are considered sacred, if not divine, by the people of the steppe.
VANILLA: The Ashina clan rose to prominence after revolting against the Rouran Khaganate. Members of the clan are considered sacred, if not divine, by the people of the steppe.

SED: One of the oldest Christian dynasties in the world. The children of Bagrat have made Georgia and Armenia flourish throughout the centuries.
SWMH: One of the oldest Christian dynasties in the world. The children of Bagrat have made Georgia and Armenia flourish throughout the centuries.
VANILLA: One of the oldest Christian dynasties in the world. The children of Bagrat have made Georgia flourish throughout the centuries.

SWMH: A descendant of one of the seven Parthian clans under Sassanid rule. The seven clans, or houses, played key importance in early Persian history.
VANILLA: A descendant of one of the seven Parthian clans under Sassanid rule. The seven clans, or houses, played key importance in Persian history.

SED: The founder of the Sassanid dynasty. Known as a great warrior, hunter and high priest of the Zoroastrian faith.
SWMH: The founder of the Sassanid dynasty. Known as a great warrior, hunter and high priest of the Zoroastrian faith.
VANILLA: The founder of the Sassanid dynasty. Known as a great warrior, hunter and high priest of the Zoroastrian faith.

SED: A legendary high king of Ireland and founder of the Uí Néill dynasty. During his rule he won several battles against the Saxons, Scots, Gauls and even the Romans.
SWMH: A legendary high king of Ireland and founder of the Uí Néill dynasty. During his rule he won several battles against the Saxons, Scots, Gauls and even the Romans.
VANILLA: A legendary high king of Ireland and founder of the Uí Néill dynasty. During his rule he won several battles against the Saxons, Scots, Gauls and even the Romans.

SED: Vanquisher of both Moors and Leonese in his campaigns for Portuguese independence, Alfonso cunningly battled many enemies to establish the roots of his own realm.
SWMH: Vanquisher of both Moors and Leonese in his campaigns for Portuguese independence, Alfonso cunningly battled many enemies to establish the roots of his own realm.
VANILLA: Vanquisher of both Moors and Leonese in his campaigns for Portuguese independence, Alfonso cunningly battled many enemies to establish the roots of his own realm.

SED: Lord over half of Iberia, Alfonso claimed the title “Emperor of all Spain” and sought to unify the peninsula under his rule. He was also known as a patron of arts.
SWMH: Lord over half of Iberia, Alfonso claimed the title “Emperor of all Spain” and sought to unify the peninsula under his rule. He was also known as a patron of arts.
VANILLA: Lord over half of Iberia, Alfonso claimed the title “Emperor of all Spain” and sought to unify the peninsula under his rule. He was also known as a patron of arts.

SED: Known as James the Conqueror, he established dominance over the Mediterranean Sea. He is also remembered as a sponsor of artists and a notorious lawmaker.
SWMH: Known as James the Conqueror, he established dominance over the Mediterranean Sea. He is also remembered as a sponsor of artists and a notorious lawmaker.
VANILLA: Known as James the Conqueror, he established dominance over the Mediterranean Sea. He is also remembered as a sponsor of artists and a notorious lawmaker.

SED: Warrior-king of the Basques and a major sponsor of the Reconquista, Garcia restored Basque control over Navarre after a long period of Aragonese domination.
SWMH: Warrior-king of the Basques and a major sponsor of the Reconquista, Garcia restored Basque control over Navarra after a long period of Aragonese domination.
VANILLA: Warrior-king of the Basques and a major sponsor of the Reconquista, Garcia restored Basque control over Navarra after a long period of Aragonese domination.

SED: Known as a champion of the faithful, diplomat and friend to Christians, Muhammad managed to keep alive the light of Al-Andalus despite the Castillian invasion.
SWMH: Known as a champion of the faithful, diplomat and friend to Christians, Muhammad managed to keep alive the light of Al-Andalus despite the Castillian invasion.
VANILLA: Known as a champion of the faithful, diplomat and friend to Christians, Muhammad managed to keep alive the light of Al-Andalus despite the Castillian invasion.

SED: The Keita dynasty claim descent from Bilali Bounama (Bilal ibn Rabah), a freed slave who became the first muezzin. Mansa Musa is the most renowned of its rulers.
SWMH: The Keita dynasty claim descent from Bilali Bounama (Bilal ibn Rabah), a freed slave who became the first muezzin. Mansa Musa is the most renowned of its rulers.
VANILLA: A scholar and conqueror, Musa became a legend in the Islamic world for the vast wealth and majesty of his African kingdom. He also sponsored many construction projects.

SED: A major leader of the First Crusade, Bohemond used his legendary martial skill and political cunning to capture Antioch and establish a kingdom for himself in the Levant.
SWMH: A major leader of the First Crusade, Bohemond used his legendary martial skill and political cunning to capture Antioch and establish a kingdom for himself in the Levant.
VANILLA: A major leader of the First Crusade, Bohemond used his legendary martial skill and political cunning to capture Antioch and establish a kingdom for himself in the Levant.

SED: Last of the great Norman conquerors, Roger unified Sicily under his rule, transforming it into a local power responsible for raids across the Muslim lands.
SWMH: Last of the great Norman conquerors, Roger unified Sicily under his rule, transforming it into a local power responsible for raids across the Muslim lands.
VANILLA: Last of the great Norman conquerors, Roger unified Sicily under his rule, transforming it into a local power responsible for raids across the Muslim lands.

SED: A leader of the Fourth Crusade, Baldwin fought alongside the Venetians to topple the last remnant of the Roman Empire, becoming the first Latin Emperor of Constantinople.
SWMH: A leader of the Fourth Crusade, Baldouin fought alongside the Venetians to topple the last remnant of the Roman Empire, becoming the first Latin Emperor of Constantinople.
VANILLA: A leader of the Fourth Crusade, Baldouin fought alongside the Venetians to topple the last remnant of the Roman Empire, becoming the first Latin Emperor of Constantinople.

SED: Ghiyath al-Din emerged victorious against the Mongols, rival warlords, and Hindu states, founding the Tughluq dynasty in northern India.
SWMH: Ghiyath ud-Din emerged victorious against the Mongols, rival warlords, and Hindu states, founding the Tughluq dynasty in northern India.
VANILLA: Founder of the Tughluq dynasty, he expanded Muslim reach across the Indian subcontinent and successfully repealed the Mongol menace.

SED: Founder of the Ottoman dynasty, Osman rose to prominence as a daring commander, achieving victories against both Greeks and fellow Turks in his campaigns.
SWMH: Founder of the Ottoman dynasty, Osman rose to prominence as a daring commander, achieving victories against both Greeks and fellow Turks in his campaigns.
VANILLA: Founder of the Ottoman dynasty, Osman rose to prominence as a daring commander, achieving victories against both Greeks and fellow Turks in his campaigns.

SED: The mastermind behind the Fourth Crusade and the sack of Constantinople, Enrico is remembered as one of the most successful and prosperous doges Venice ever had.
SWMH: The mastermind behind the Fourth Crusade and the sack of Constantinople, Enrico is remembered as one of the most successful and prosperous doges Venice ever had.
VANILLA: The mastermind behind the Fourth Crusade and the sack of Constantinople, Enrico is remembered as one of the most successful and prosperous doges Venice ever had.

SED: As leaders of the Almoravid movement, Abu Bakr and Yusuf united the southern Sanhaja Berber tribes and expanded into western Maghreb, extending Almoravid rule over Andalusia.
SWMH: As leaders of the Almoravid movement, Abu Bakr and Yusuf united the southern Sanhaja Berber tribes and expanded into western Maghreb, extending Almoravid rule over Andalusia.
VANILLA: Yusuf was invited by the emirs of Andalusia to come to Iberia and stop the Christian onslaught. He won, and established a vast realm extending from Ghana to Toledo.

SED: As successor to Muhammad ibn Tumart's Almohad movement, Abd al-Mu’min proved himself an energetic conqueror, bringing the Maghreb, Ifriqiya, and Andalusia under his control.
SWMH: As successor to Muhammad ibn Tumart's Almohad movement, Abd al-Mu'min proved himself an energetic conqueror, bringing the Maghreb, Ifriqiya, and Andalusia under his control.
VANILLA: Leader of the Almohad dynasty, the reign of Abu made both trade and science prosper, with his administrative and military skills being successful in halting the Reconquista.

SED: Once sold in a slave market, Baibars would eventually become the man responsible for both defeating the Mongol advance and dealing a decisive blow to the Crusader states of the Levant.
SWMH: Once sold in a slave market, Baibars would eventually become the man responsible for both defeating the Mongol advance and dealing a decisive blow to the Crusader States of the Levant.
VANILLA: Once sold in a slave market, Baibars would eventually become the man responsible for both defeating the Mongol advance and removing the Crusader States from the Levant.

VANILLA: A pious and respected leader of the Third Crusade, Philippe fought against both heretics and infidels with great success.
